org.apache.felix.ipojo.manipulator
Class Pojoization

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.felix.ipojo.manipulator.Pojoization

public class Pojoization
extends java.lang.Object

Pojoization allows creating an iPOJO bundle from a "normal" bundle.

Author:
Felix Project Team

m_ignoreLocalXSD

private boolean m_ignoreLocalXSD
Flag describing if we need or not use local XSD files (i.e. use the SchemaResolver or not). If true the local XSD are not used.

pojoization

public void pojoization(java.io.File in,
                        java.io.File out,
                        java.io.InputStream metadata)
Manipulates an input bundle. This method creates an iPOJO bundle based on the given metadata file. The original and final bundles must be different.

Parameters:
in - the original bundle.
out - the final bundle.
metadata - the iPOJO metadata input stream.

pojoization

public void pojoization(java.io.File in,
                        java.io.File out,
                        java.io.File metadataFile)
Manipulates an input bundle. This method creates an iPOJO bundle based on the given metadata file. The original and final bundles must be different.

Parameters:
in - the original bundle.
out - the final bundle.
metadataFile - the iPOJO metadata file (XML).

inC - : the class to inspect.

manipulateInnerClass

private void manipulateInnerClass(java.util.jar.JarFile inputJar,
                                  java.util.jar.JarEntry je,
                                  java.lang.String innerClassName,
                                  Pojoization.ComponentInfo ci)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Manipulates an inner class.

Parameters:
inputJar - input jar
je - inner class jar entry
innerClassName - inner class name
ci - component info of the component owning the inner class
Throws:
java.io.IOException - the inner class cannot be read

Returns:
the generated manifest.

                                   java.util.jar.JarEntry je,
                                   Pojoization.ComponentInfo ci)
Manipulate a component class.

Parameters:
in - : the byte array of the class to manipulate
je - : Jar entry of the classes
ci - : attached component info (containing metadata and manipulation metadata)
Returns:
the generated class (byte array)

setImports

private void setImports(java.util.jar.Attributes att)
Add imports to the given manifest attribute list. This method add ipojo imports and handler imports (if needed).

Parameters:
att - : the manifest attribute list to modify.

setPOJOMetadata

private void setPOJOMetadata(java.util.jar.Attributes att)
Add iPOJO-Components to the given manifest attribute list. This method add the iPOJO-Components header and its value (according to the metadata) to the manifest.

Parameters:
att - : the manifest attribute list to modify.

parseHeader

public java.util.Map parseHeader(java.lang.String value)
Standard OSGi header parser. This parser can handle the format clauses ::= clause ( ',' clause ) + clause ::= name ( ';' name ) (';' key '=' value ) This is mapped to a Map { name => Map { attr|directive => value } }

Parameters:
value - : String to parse.
Returns:
parsed map.

printClauses

public java.lang.String printClauses(java.util.Map exports,
                                     java.lang.String allowedDirectives)
Print a standard Map based OSGi header.

Parameters:
exports - : map { name => Map { attribute|directive => value } }
allowedDirectives - : list of allowed directives.
Returns:
the clauses

parseXMLMetadata

Parse XML Metadata.

Parameters:
stream - metadata input stream.
Returns:
the parsed element array.

the list of referenced packages.

buildManifestMetadata

                                                     java.lang.StringBuffer actual)
Generate manipulation metadata.

Parameters:
element - : actual element.
actual - : actual manipulation metadata.

: given manipulation metadata + manipulation metadata of the given element.
